article.headline: Vanderbilt 74, Belmont 59
article.story: NASHVILLE, Tenn. (AP) -- Matt Freije scored 24 points, including 17 in the first half, as Vanderbilt beat Belmont 74-59 Friday night in the season-opener for both teams. Scott Hundley added 13 points and seven rebounds off the bench for Vanderbilt. The Commodores took control early in the first half with an 11-0 run on their way to a 37-21 halftime lead. Belmont closed the gap to 47-40 early in the second half, but couldn't get any closer after a 16-0 run by Vanderbilt that pushed the lead over 13 points for the rest of the night. Vanderbilt outrebounded Belmont 50-34 on the night, and the Bruins shot just 35 percent. Belmont forward Adam Mark, who led the nation last year with a .670 field goal percentage, was held to 6-for-13 shooting for the game. Josh Godwin led the Bruins with 17 points, Mark finished with 14 and Nick Otis had 11. The game was played before a sellout crowd of 5,073 in the debut of the $52 million Curb Event Center at Belmont. It was the Bruins' first game on campus in two years.
